name: Incline Dumbbell Fly
how_to_perform:
1. Start by sitting on an incline bench with your back against the pad, feet flat on the ground.

2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, keeping your arms straight and resting them on top of your thighs.

3. Slowly lift both dumbbells out to your sides until they are at shoulder height, keeping your elbows slightly bent.

4. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles as you lift the dumbbells.

5. Pause briefly at the top of the movement.

6. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.

7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The incline dumbbell fly is a chest-focused exercise that targets the pectoralis major muscle, performed on an incline bench with dumbbells.
